intro: Palicourea longistipula, commonly known as the long-styled palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Palicourea longistipula is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
